intro: Mniarum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and small, closely packed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a smooth, often shiny surface. Mniarum fasciculatum plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
